subject: Re: [junit] Re: [OT] DBC semantics (was Re: About the value     of    JUnit)
msgSnippet: Q: What is a sufficiently precise contract ? Possible A: A set of Programmer Tests. Other As? ... J. B. Rainsberger, President, Diaspar Software Services
messageBody:
Q: What is a "sufficiently precise contract"?

Possible A: A set of Programmer Tests.

Other As?

>So said Paul Christmann on 4/8/2003 --------------------
>J. B. Rainsberger wrote:
>> Any more precise, though, and you're writing the algorithm. :)
>
>Agreed. And that's the part of DBC that I just don't get. Without a
>precise contract, I don't see the value. With a precice contract, I've
>got the same code twice.
>
>PC
>
>Paul Christmann
>Prior Artisans, LLC
